prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism has a small rectangular opening on one side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation and a small translation along the z-axis: Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0195] Draw the first face of the sketch as a rectangle with the following vertices: (0.0, 0.0) (0.525, 0.0) (0.525, 0.75) (0.0, 0.75) (0.0, 0.0) Draw the second face of the sketch as a rectangle with the following vertices: (0.0195, 0.0195) (0.5055, 0.0195) (0.5055, 0.3364) (0.0195, 0.3364) (0.0195, 0.0195) Draw the third face of the sketch as a rectangle with the following vertices: (0.0195, 0.3559) (0.5055, 0.3559) (0.5055, 0.7305) (0.0195, 0.7305) (0.0195, 0.3559) Scale the sketch uniformly by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch. Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.12 towards the normal. Part 2 Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a front face angled at approximately 45 degrees from the top and bottom faces. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation and a small translation along the z-axis: Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0195] Draw the first face of the sketch as a rectangle with the same vertices as Part 1, face 1. Draw the second face of the sketch as a rectangle with the same vertices as Part 1, face 2. Draw the third face of the sketch as a rectangle with the same vertices as Part 1, face 3. Do not extrude the 3D sketch. Instead, create a JoinFeatureOperation between Part 1 and Part 2, providing a depth of 0.0195 in the opposite direction of the normal. Part 3 Construct a CAD model of a rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular prism attached to its side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation along the x-axis and z-axis: Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Translation Vector: [0.255, 0.0, 0.1395] Draw the first face of the sketch as a rectangle with the following vertices: (0.0, 0.0) (0.045, 0.0) (0.045, 0.0075) (0.0, 0.0075) (0.0, 0.0) Draw the second face of the sketch as a rectangle with the following vertices: (0.2625, 0.555) (0.27, 0.555) (0.27, 0.6) (0.2625, 0.6) (0.2625, 0.555) Scale the sketch uniformly by a factor of 0.6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch. Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.045 towards the normal.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered End The shape to be constructed is a cylindrical object with a tapered end, similar to a pencil or pen. It has a smooth surface and appears to be made of a solid material, with symmetry along its length, suggesting it could be used for mechanical or structural purposes. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation. This will serve as the base for constructing the CAD model. Step 2: Draw the first 2D sketch 1. Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw two overlapping circles, one with a radius of 0.0317 units and another with a radius of 0.0226 units. * The first circle will be the base of the cylindrical object, while the second one will be the top of the tapered end. * Make sure the circles share the same center point, located at (0.0317, 0.0317). Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the entire 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0634. This will determine the overall size of the cylindrical object. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch 1. Set the euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) in degrees to maintain symmetry. 2. Define the translation vector to be (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) since there's no need for translation. 3. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the defined Euler angles and translation vector. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model 1. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.75 units. 2. Extrude the 2D sketch in the opposite direction of the normals by 0.0 units. 3. Set the sketch scaling to 0.0634 units. This completes the construction for Part 1. The resulting shape will be a solid cylindrical object with a tapered end, having the length, width, and height as follows: * Length: 0.0634 units * Width: 0.0634 units * Height: 0.75 units</description>

<description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side** The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. 1. **Create a new coordinate system**: The euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. **Draw the 2D sketch**: On the X-Y plane, draw a rectangle with the following dimensions: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.1875] to [0.1875, 0.1875] - Line 2: [0.1875, 0.1875] to [0.1875, 0.0] - Line 3: [0.1875, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] - Line 4: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.1875] - Line 5: [0.75, 0.1875] to [0.4687, 0.1875] - Line 6: [0.4687, 0.1875] to [0.4687, 0.5625] - Line 7: [0.4687, 0.5625] to [0.75, 0.5625] - Line 8: [0.75, 0.5625] to [0.75, 0.75] - Line 9: [0.75, 0.75] to [0.1875, 0.75] - Line 10: [0.1875, 0.75] to [0.1875, 0.5625] - Line 11: [0.1875, 0.5625] to [0.0, 0.5625] - Line 12: [0.0, 0.5625] to [0.0, 0.1875] 3. **Scale the 2D sketch**: Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch**: Rotate the 2D sketch about the Z-axis, then about the Y-axis, then about the X-axis using the euler angles defined in the coordinate system. prompt: <description>Part 1 Shape Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 10 units long, 5 units wide, and 2 units tall. The curved side has a radius of 3 units. Instructions Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 that is rotated -90 degrees around the X and Z axes and translated by 0.0098 along the Y axis. Next, draw the first face of the prism as a 2D sketch using the coordinate system. The sketch should be a rectangle with dimensions of 0.75 units along the X axis and 0.1937 units along the Y axis. The rectangle should be centered at the origin of the coordinate system. Add a fillet constraint to the four corners of the rectangle, with a radius of 0.03 units. This will give the rectangle rounded corners. Create a new loop that connects the four rounded corners in a clockwise direction. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z axis by a distance of 0.75 units. This will create the first part of the prism. Part 2 Shape Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front face is angled at 45 degrees. Instructions Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2 that is rotated -90 degrees around the X and Z axes and translated by 0.75 along the X axis, 0.0 along the Y axis, and 0.045 along the Z axis. Next, draw the first face of the prism as a 2D sketch using the coordinate system. The sketch should be a rectangle with dimensions of 0.0012 units along the X axis and 0.1487 units along the Y axis. The rectangle should be centered at the origin of the coordinate system. Add a linear constraint to the two vertical edges of the rectangle, with a slope of 1 and an intercept of 0. This will angle the rectangle at 45 degrees. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z axis by a distance of 0.0012 units to create the second part of the prism. Use the "JoinFeatureOperation" to join the first and second parts of the prism together. This will create a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one side. Height, Width, and Length The height of the final shape is 2 units, the width is 5 units, and the length is 10 units. The height and width of each part are equal to the height and width of the final shape. The length of each part is equal to the length of the final shape plus the extrude depth of that part.</description>
